original_title: Several goods to be exempt from VAT
original_body_lines: Finance State Minister Ranjith Siyambalapitiya has presented the Value-Added Tax (Amendment) Bill to the Parliament this morning (Dec.10).
Addressing the House, the lawmaker said the VAT would be imposed on 97 out of the 138 goods that were previously freed from the tax.
As such, medicines, equipment used by disabled persons, rice flour, corn flour, vegetables, fruits, liquid milk, and the ‘Suwaseriya’ ambulance service will not be subjected to VAT.
The parliamentary debate on the Second Reading of the VAT (Amendment) Bill commenced earlier this morning (Dec.10).
